verses.text_plain: In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came unto him, and said unto him, Thus saith the Lord, Set thine house in order: for thou shalt die, and not live.
verses.verse_html:
1In those days was Hezekiah sick unto death. And Isaiah the prophet the son of Amoz came unto him, and said unto him, Thus saith the Lord, Set thine house in order: for thou shalt die, and not live. ▼
▼ Set…: Heb. Give charge concerning thy house

footnotes.body_text: ▼ Set…: Heb. Give charge concerning thy house
footnotes.body_html: ▼ Set…: Heb. Give charge concerning thy house

verses.text_plain: Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed unto the Lord,
verses.verse_html: 2Then Hezekiah turned his face toward the wall, and prayed unto the Lord,

verses.text_plain: And said, Remember now, O Lord, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore.
verses.verse_html:
3And said, Remember now, O Lord, I beseech thee, how I have walked before thee in truth and with a perfect heart, and have done that which is good in thy sight. And Hezekiah wept sore. ▼
▼ sore: Heb. with great weeping

footnotes.body_html: ▼ sore: Heb. with great weeping

verses.text_plain: Then came the word of the Lord to Isaiah, saying,
verses.verse_html: 4Then came the word of the Lord to Isaiah, saying,

verses.text_plain: Go, and say to Hezekiah, Thus saith the Lord, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.
verses.verse_html: 5Go, and say to Hezekiah, Thus saith the Lord, the God of David thy father, I have heard thy prayer, I have seen thy tears: behold, I will add unto thy days fifteen years.

verses.text_plain: And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria: and I will defend this city.
verses.verse_html: 6And I will deliver thee and this city out of the hand of the king of Assyria: and I will defend this city.

verses.text_plain: And this shall be a sign unto thee from the Lord, that the Lord will do this thing that he hath spoken;
verses.verse_html: 7And this shall be a sign unto thee from the Lord, that the Lord will do this thing that he hath spoken;

verses.text_plain: Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees, which is gone down in the sun dial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward. So the sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down.
verses.verse_html:
8Behold, I will bring again the shadow of the degrees, which is gone down in the sun dial of Ahaz, ten degrees backward. So the sun returned ten degrees, by which degrees it was gone down. ▼
▼ sun dial: Heb. degrees by, or, with the sun

footnotes.body_text: ▼ sun dial: Heb. degrees by, or, with the sun
footnotes.body_html: ▼ sun dial: Heb. degrees by, or, with the sun

verses.text_plain: The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and was recovered of his sickness:
verses.verse_html: 9The writing of Hezekiah king of Judah, when he had been sick, and was recovered of his sickness:

verses.text_plain: I said in the cutting off of my days, I shall go to the gates of the grave: I am deprived of the residue of my years.
verses.verse_html: 10I said in the cutting off of my days, I shall go to the gates of the grave: I am deprived of the residue of my years.

verses.text_plain: I said, I shall not see the Lord, even the Lord, in the land of the living: I shall behold man no more with the inhabitants of the world.
verses.verse_html: 11I said, I shall not see the Lord, even the Lord, in the land of the living: I shall behold man no more with the inhabitants of the world.

verses.text_plain: Mine age is departed, and is removed from me as a shepherd’s tent: I have cut off like a weaver my life: he will cut me off with pining sickness: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.
verses.verse_html:
12Mine age is departed, and is removed from me as a shepherd’s tent: I have cut off like a weaver my life: he will cut me off with pining sickness: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me. ▼
▼ with…: or, from the thrum

footnotes.body_html: ▼ with…: or, from the thrum

verses.text_plain: I reckoned till morning, that, as a lion, so will he break all my bones: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.
verses.verse_html: 13I reckoned till morning, that, as a lion, so will he break all my bones: from day even to night wilt thou make an end of me.

verses.text_plain: Like a crane or a swallow, so did I chatter: I did mourn as a dove: mine eyes fail with looking upward: O Lord, I am oppressed; undertake for me.
verses.verse_html:
14Like a crane or a swallow, so did I chatter: I did mourn as a dove: mine eyes fail with looking upward: O Lord, I am oppressed; undertake for me. ▼
▼ undertake…: or, ease me

footnotes.body_html: ▼ undertake…: or, ease me

verses.text_plain: What shall I say? he hath both spoken unto me, and himself hath done it: I shall go softly all my years in the bitterness of my soul.
verses.verse_html: 15What shall I say? he hath both spoken unto me, and himself hath done it: I shall go softly all my years in the bitterness of my soul.

tokens.text: unto me, and himself hath done

verses.text_plain: O Lord, by these things men live, and in all these things is the life of my spirit: so wilt thou recover me, and make me to live.
verses.verse_html: 16O Lord, by these things men live, and in all these things is the life of my spirit: so wilt thou recover me, and make me to live.

tokens.text: me, and make me to live

verses.text_plain: Behold, for peace I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back.
verses.verse_html:
17Behold, for peace I had great bitterness: but thou hast in love to my soul delivered it from the pit of corruption: for thou hast cast all my sins behind thy back. ▼
▼ for peace…: or, on my peace came great bitterness
 , ▼
▼ thou hast in…: Heb. thou hast loved my soul from the pit

footnotes.body_text: ▼ for peace…: or, on my peace came great bitterness
footnotes.body_html: ▼ for peace…: or, on my peace came great bitterness

footnotes.body_text: ▼ thou hast in…: Heb. thou hast loved my soul from the pit
footnotes.body_html: ▼ thou hast in…: Heb. thou hast loved my soul from the pit

verses.text_plain: For the grave cannot praise thee, death can not celebrate thee: they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thy truth.
verses.verse_html: 18For the grave cannot praise thee, death can not celebrate thee: they that go down into the pit cannot hope for thy truth.

verses.text_plain: The living, the living, he shall praise thee, as I do this day: the father to the children shall make known thy truth.
verses.verse_html: 19The living, the living, he shall praise thee, as I do this day: the father to the children shall make known thy truth.

verses.text_plain: The Lord was ready to save me: therefore we will sing my songs to the stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of the Lord.
verses.verse_html: 20The Lord was ready to save me: therefore we will sing my songs to the stringed instruments all the days of our life in the house of the Lord.

tokens.text: me: therefore we will sing my songs

verses.text_plain: For Isaiah had said, Let them take a lump of figs, and lay it for a plaister upon the boil, and he shall recover.
verses.verse_html: 21For Isaiah had said, Let them take a lump of figs, and lay it for a plaister upon the boil, and he shall recover.

verses.text_plain: Hezekiah also had said, What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the Lord?
verses.verse_html: 22Hezekiah also had said, What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the Lord?
